channel.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
channel.description:
Since I was called awhile back to design a new look for the SSP I have had alot happen. Since all of that is now over I am ready to start the work on the new look of the SSP. I will use this thread as an update log displaying what I have done, etc.
[b]Please note[/b]: I am not in charge of any functionality and the actual use of my design is still in the air.
Update Log:
[code] Started the page. My HDD drive died so now I have to start over. The page will not be using any frameworks. I would rather code it from scratch. [/code]

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

There are ways to prevent that

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:42, topic:527133”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=645879.msg4347686#msg4347686 date=1376146010]

I think the premium servers should have a brighter, more regal colour.

If you have color suggestions just post the hex value and I’ll work with it.

#ffcc66

Also, just to verify the accordion effect you were talking about with the cells. Does this mean if you click a cell, it expands and displays more in-depth information? So the cell itself will have name, maybe a small thumbnail, and server IP/creator, then when you expand it, it has more information? What are you going to use for the accordion effect too? JavaScript?

The accordion effect is powered by the jQuery UI. (jQuery UI). The “bar” persay would be clicked/hovered and that would display more indepth information and screenshot gallery. Images will be in a small gallery thing and when clicked would be displayed with a lightbox effect.
[/quote]
Very nice. In my opinion, you should have it set to where you click the bar, instead of hovering it. I think hovering it would cause too many troubles, if someone is rapidly moving their mouse around the page (for whatever reason) there’s going to be bars opening all over. :P[/quote]
Or if they’re using touchscreen

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:27, topic:527133”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=645879.msg4346924#msg4346924 date=1376017534]

I think the premium servers should have a brighter, more regal colour.

If you have color suggestions just post the hex value and I’ll work with it.

#ffcc66

Also, just to verify the accordion effect you were talking about with the cells. Does this mean if you click a cell, it expands and displays more in-depth information? So the cell itself will have name, maybe a small thumbnail, and server IP/creator, then when you expand it, it has more information? What are you going to use for the accordion effect too? JavaScript?
[/quote]

The accordion effect is powered by the jQuery UI. (jQuery UI). The “bar” persay would be clicked/hovered and that would display more indepth information and screenshot gallery. Images will be in a small gallery thing and when clicked would be displayed with a lightbox effect.[/quote]
Very nice. In my opinion, you should have it set to where you click the bar, instead of hovering it. I think hovering it would cause too many troubles, if someone is rapidly moving their mouse around the page (for whatever reason) there’s going to be bars opening all over.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:28, topic:527133”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=645879.msg4346924#msg4346924 date=1376017534]

I think the premium servers should have a brighter, more regal colour.

If you have color suggestions just post the hex value and I’ll work with it.

#ffcc66

Also, just to verify the accordion effect you were talking about with the cells. Does this mean if you click a cell, it expands and displays more in-depth information? So the cell itself will have name, maybe a small thumbnail, and server IP/creator, then when you expand it, it has more information? What are you going to use for the accordion effect too? JavaScript?
[/quote]
Why wouldn’t you use css? The only drawback I can think of is limited sport for older IEs.[/quote]

Lazy + I’m supporting IE.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:29, topic:527133”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=645879.msg4347688#msg4347688 date=1376146207]

I think the premium servers should have a brighter, more regal colour.

If you have color suggestions just post the hex value and I’ll work with it.

#ffcc66

Also, just to verify the accordion effect you were talking about with the cells. Does this mean if you click a cell, it expands and displays more in-depth information? So the cell itself will have name, maybe a small thumbnail, and server IP/creator, then when you expand it, it has more information? What are you going to use for the accordion effect too? JavaScript?

Why wouldn’t you use css? The only drawback I can think of is limited sport for older IEs.
[/quote]You’re able to achieve fluid and smooth movements with CSS alone?[/quote]Yes, and they’re a lot more fluid and smooth than JavaScript since they can be hardware accelerated.

MDN Web Docs

Using CSS animations

CSS animations make it possible to animate transitions from one CSS style configuration to another.


MDN Web Docs

Using CSS transitions

CSS transitions provide a way to control animation speed when changing CSS properties. Instead of having property changes take effect immediately, you can cause the changes in a property to take place over a period of time.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:527133”]That one pixel difference between the blue row and the white row for the announcement or whatever is kicking off my OCD. (EDIT - There isn’t actually a difference it seems, it’s just that the border around the white row is gray and really hard to see over the temporary background)

Good luck though ;)[/quote]
Thanks for clearing that up. I was about to go mad!

Read full topic

item.title: Server Status Remodel Project Thread
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:29, topic:527133”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=645879.msg4347688#msg4347688 date=1376146207]

I think the premium servers should have a brighter, more regal colour.

If you have color suggestions just post the hex value and I’ll work with it.

#ffcc66

Also, just to verify the accordion effect you were talking about with the cells. Does this mean if you click a cell, it expands and displays more in-depth information? So the cell itself will have name, maybe a small thumbnail, and server IP/creator, then when you expand it, it has more information? What are you going to use for the accordion effect too? JavaScript?

Why wouldn’t you use css? The only drawback I can think of is limited sport for older IEs.
[/quote]You’re able to achieve fluid and smooth movements with CSS alone?[/quote]
I believe so, with css transitions. Doing it I’m JavaScript is a bad idea imo - if someone isn’t using JS then the whole page is useless for them.

Read full topic
